intro: Collania involucrosa, commonly known as the woolly sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its grayish-blue foliage, which is covered in fine, woolly hairs, providing it with a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Collania involucrosa is drought-tolerant and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant suitable for xeriscaping.
